comment: LISTEN he isn't difficult he is just manic. Like in the beginning of the semester he sent us 6 different syllabus and they were each equally as confusing and terribly formatted as the next. I think he teaches multiple classes because the titles were weird. There was not assignments per se but there were case studies IDK take him at your own risk.

Hope is a tough professor, and his class is not easy. You can get an A, but you'll go through hell to get it. His test questions are often very deceiving to trick you into choosing the *almost* right answer, but it's not quite right. He expects you to read the entire chapter in the textbook before he covers it in class. He is passionate, but mean.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: His grading is very unclear and he did not express what he wanted us to study for his tests. I wouldn't recommend him if you value structured learning and fair assessments.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: This is the worst professor I have ever taken. His lectures make no sense, he is rude to everyone during his classes, telling us that we are going to fail in the real world for not answering his ridiculous questions. He is always going off on tangents and he is impossible to talk to. He won't admit to or fix his mistakes because of embarrassment.

Take another professor, seriously. He is horrible at giving lectures, and is worse at explaining the project. You have one semester long group project, and he constantly goes on tangents about it for like 30 mins of the class. He is AWFUL with emails, and will always reply with a pretentious "hope this helps."

So, "Hope this helps", don't take him
Great professor. 4 tests and half of the exams are examples he gives in class. It is not mandatory but I recommend showing up. Semester-long group project.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor T is passionate about marketing and a great teacher. He is helpful and direct. Anyone who did badly in his class probably did not read the book or pay attention in class. He gives examples in class that are on the test. Super easy A if you aren't lazy.

Professor Hope is a good professor but students seem to think he is not because you have to show up in order to succeed. Half of the tests are examples he gives in class so although attendance is not mandatory, it is important. He guides you to future paths in your careers. There is a semester-long group project.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: TAKE ANOTHER PROFESSOR! Absolutely unapproachable and unhelpful. I learned nothing other than how to deep breathe through the most tedious and useless class I've ever taken. Every student in the class was confused by his verbose and pretentious language.

This guy is the most pretentious person you will ever meet. If you never talk to him it's fine, but if you ever need help on anything, prepare for sass, attitude, and a big F you. Tests are easy enough, but he assigns an annoying group project. He will say attendance isn't mandatory, but then will say incredibly important info only in class.

If you can take someone else, DO IT! If you need help, he will be rude in an email & tell you to ask your classmates. His lectures are kind of informative but his test are hard & not easy to pass. He pushes you to get a sales job every class. Top 3 worst professor I ever had. He doesn't care about his students, esp when COVID-19 happened.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Steer clear... Tests are difficult and even if you read the textbook, they are just as hard. So, just don't.

Worst teacher i have ever had. He threw out the course material and tested off what he says. You could read the entire book everyday for a year and still get a C on tests. He writes them himself so you have to figure out the answer he wants. Every test had a failing average and that made him happy. He should see it as a reflection of teaching(none
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Don't. Just don't. Some easy exams, but then he throws in random SUPER hard exams throughout the semester. Know all key terms for exams. He's plain rude, and is not very reasonable.

He is literally the worst. So rude, he argues with students, and grades unbelievably hard. Our first test average was a 65 and he thought it was good, and that we were at fault and not him. He is so disrespectful and an awful professor. DO NOT TAKE HIM. I withdrew from his class.

This was a very tough professor. He was very nice, and included a lot of personal experiences in his lectures, but the tests were very tricky. He was very clear on his expectations with the project, but it was hard to know exactly what would be on the tests. Tests were what made my grade go down, very long and very tricky. Great professor though!

Dr. T is probably the hardest prof I have ever had. He is very intelligent but his standards are ridiculous! Its IN MKT but he focuses on Asian Markets 90% of the time and barely looks at other markets. I would have to make a 20 page study guide just to make a C on the test. Very challenging
